visualization_prompt: Generate a pie chart showing market share distribution of vehicle registrations using a donut chart technique with proportional inner radius
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains four categorical variables representing vehicle types (EV, Hybrids, Diesel, Petrol) with percentage market shares. As original source data from CleanTechnica is used, no synthetic generation was required. Values sum to 100% with EV dominating at 68.1%, reflecting Norway's electric vehicle adoption trends. The donut chart implementation maximizes data-ink ratio by removing redundant radial labels while maintaining proportional perception through angular comparisons. Cairo's principles of salience are addressed through strategic color contrast between EV (dark blue) and combustion engines (lighter blues). The inner radius reduction focuses attention on relative segment sizes while preserving numerical labels for exact comparisons. Percentage formatting follows Tufte's recommendation for direct label embedding, eliminating need for separate legends during initial interpretation.
